message:
SYSTEM: 05_OWL.pdf: Página 10
© O. Corcho, MC Suárez de Figueroa Baonza
14
OWL 2
Most common axioms in definitions
•
Classes
–
Subclass
C1 ⊆C2
Human ⊆Animal ∩Biped
–
Equivalence
C1 ≡C2
Man ≡Human ∩Male
–
Disjointness
C1 ∩C2 ⊆⊥
Male ∩Female ⊆⊥
•
Properties/roles
–
Subproperty
P1 ⊆P2
hasDaughter ⊆hasChild
–
Equivalence
P1 ≡P2
cost ≡price
–
Inverse
P1 ≡P2-
hasChild ≡hasParent-
–
Transitive
P+ ⊆P
ancestor+ ⊆ancestor
–
Functional
Τ ⊆≤1P
T ⊆≤1hasMother
–
InverseFunctional
Τ ⊆≤1P-
T ⊆≤1hasPassportID-
–
And also... Reflexive, Irreflexive, Symmetric, Asymmetric
•
Individuals
–
Equivalence
{x1} ≡{x2}
{oeg:OscarCorcho} ≡{img:Oscar}
–
Different
{x1} ≡¬{x2}
{john} ≡¬{peter}
–
Negative object property and datatype property assertions
¬{P a1 a2}
¬ {hasChild john peter}
•
Most axioms are reducible to inclusion (∪)
–
C ≡D iff both C ⊆D and D ⊆C  ; C disjoint D iff C ⊆¬D
speaker: SYSTEM
